criteria.description: Reward tiers clearly differentiate exact count vs off-by-one vs larger misses, with documented values.
criteria.justification: Continuous reward via 1 - diff/target yields 1.0 for exact matches and smaller penalties for off-by-one and larger misses, but it is not tiered and does not document specific off-by-one values. See env.py: word_count_reward.

criteria.description: Theme adherence check (keyword match or embedding similarity, or an LLM call) influences reward or metadata.
criteria.justification: No theme adherence verification; only the theme string is stored in metadata. Reward and metrics ignore whether the story matches the theme.

criteria.description: Prompt themes are varied, and not just one theme repeated.
criteria.justification: Seed scenarios cover diverse themes (e.g., haunted library, cyberpunk market, interstellar coffee shop, dragon diplomacy). See env.py: _SEED_SCENARIOS.

criteria.description: More than 10 examples are seeded in the environment.
criteria.justification: Exactly 10 seed scenarios are provided, not more than 10.

criteria.description: Output sanitizer enforces plain text (no markup) and strips leading/trailing whitespace before scoring.
criteria.justification: count_words strips whitespace before splitting, but no sanitizer enforces plain-text or removes markup; only a system prompt asks for plain text. See env.py: count_words and rollout.py: system_prompt.

notes: Environment is deterministic and includes shaped rewards and useful metrics (word_diff, invalid_solution). However, it lacks theme adherence checks, plain-text enforcement, and >10 seed scenarios. Reward is continuous rather than tiered.
